titleStmt.title: Mrs. Parliament her invitation of Mrs. London, to a Thankesgiving dinner. For the great and mighty victorie, which Mr. Horton obtained over Major Powell in Wales. Their discourse, desires, designes, as you may heare from their own mouthes. Munday 29 of May, in the eight yeare of the reigne of our soveraigne Lady Parliament. ...
titleStmt.author: Mercurius Melancholicus, fl. 1648.

titleStmt.title: Mrs. Parliament her invitation of Mrs. London, to a Thankesgiving dinner. For the great and mighty victorie, which Mr. Horton obtained over Major Powell in Wales. Their discourse, desires, designes, as you may heare from their own mouthes. Munday 29 of May, in the eight yeare of the reigne of our soveraigne Lady Parliament. ...
titleStmt.author: Mercurius Melancholicus, fl. 1648.

notesStmt.note: "Mercurius Melancholicus" was a pseudonym used by a number of Royalist writers including Martin Parker and John Crouch.
Although catchword on p.3 does not match that of p.6 and text is not continuous, print show-through indicates that p.3 and p.6 were printed on the same leaf.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library.
